authors.name: leiboffs
authors.affiliation: Oregon State University, College of Agricultural Sciences, Department of Botany and Plant Pathology

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jcqc","text":"This is part of the Leiboff Lab maize transformation protocol for somatic embryogenesis of B104 immature embryos. This protocol is a combination of Chen et al. 2022 and Kang et al. 2022 with some modifications based on material availability. This protocol is intended for the GRF-GIF/BBM somatic embryogenesis transformation strategy with the LBA4404 Met- auxotrophic Agrobacterium strain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":368,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9atp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgato","text":"Embryos will be transferred (scutellum side up) from Co-cultivation Medium 562V-MSM to Resting Medium 605CefT, 3 days after infection (DAI). Prompt transfer from 562V-MSM to 605CefT will help suppress Agrobacterium contamination, which is extremely difficult to combat once it is noticeable. 605CefT should be used for 7 days, before moving embryos to Resting Medium (with selection) 605CefTB. Resting Medium contains added synthetic auxin (2,4-D) to encourage callus and shoot growth. 605CefT is high in sucrose and uses a small amount of glucose to encourage rapid plant growth. 605CefT contains no plant selective agent, and uses both Cefotaxime and Timentin to control Agrobacterium contamination. The antibiotic concentrations used here are sufficient to control the LBA4404 Met- auxotrophic strain, but were not sufficient to control wild-type LBA4404 in 3 prior trials. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":201,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":673,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq067","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b6sb","text":"605CefT solid media should be prepared in 15x100 (standard) petri plates, planning for ~20 embryos per plate. Material grown on 605CefT will be sealed with micropore tape and be incubated at 28C in the dark. Embryos are ready to move off 605CefT after 1 week. There may be noticeable growth on the scutellum side of the embryo at this time, but do not be alarmed if this is not obvious.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"56jfe","text":"DISCLAIMER – FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY; USE AT YOUR OWN RISK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ca3q7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"477br","text":"The protocol content here is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

groups.title: Transformation of B104 maize embryos using GRF-GIF/BBM somatic embryogenesis

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbgaf","text":"Chen, Zongliang, Juan M. Debernardi, Jorge Dubcovsky, and Andrea Gallavotti. 2022. “The Combination of Morphogenic Regulators BABY BOOM and GRF-GIF Improves Maize Transformation Efficiency.” bioRxiv. https://doi.org/10.1101/2022.09.02.506370.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":191,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h8ht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rei4","text":"Kang, Minjeong, Keunsub Lee, Todd Finley, Hal Chappell, Veena Veena, and Kan Wang. 2022. “An Improved Agrobacterium-Mediated Transformation and Genome-Editing Method for Maize Inbred B104 Using a Ternary Vector System and Immature Embryos.” Frontiers in Plant Science 13 (May): 860971. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpls.2022.860971.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":241,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fc6ov","text":"Estimate the volume of 605CefT you will need based on the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm4ra","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7oth3","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3l32m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nl5b","text":"Make sure to round up! Check the table below to plan your media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"Volume = 30 mL * NumberPlates","guid":"","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pdr7","text":"Retrieve the following heat-stable ingredients:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tmd4","text":"605 Medium - Stored in Main Lab, 4C Refrigerator, Top Shelf","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q0dl","text":"Casin Hydrolysate - Stored in Main Lab, Chemical shelf 'C', use Megraw stock","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"432km","text":"2,4-D (5 mg/mL) - Stored in Main Lab, -20C Freezer, Bottom drawer 'Tissue Culture 1'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en4g8","text":"Sucrose - Stored in Main Lab, Chemical shelf 'S', use Fowler refillable container","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12fgd","text":"D-Glucose - Stored in Main Lab, Chemical shelf 'G'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mou9","text":"Agar, Phyto - Stored in Main Lab, Chemical shelf 'A'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lmn0","text":"Retrieve a graduated cylinder for measuring your final solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28kcq","text":"Place a stir bar at the bottom on a beaker that is ~1.5x the volume of your solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52s9a","text":"Rinse stir bar+beaker and graduated cylinder with MQ H2O, discard rinse water in sink","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cagka","text":"NOTE: Any soap or detergent residue will interfere with the tissue culture process; if you see suds, rinse again or find different glassware","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9h93p","text":"Using a fresh weigh paper and dry spatula/scoopula/pipette tip for each ingredient, add the following to your beaker:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10uv8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ni2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"E_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,100],"data":[["Ingredient","100 mL","200 mL","300 mL","600 mL"],["605 Medium","1.1 g","2.2 g","3.3 g","6.6 g"],["Casin Hydrolysate","0.03 g","0.06 g","0.09 g","0.18 g"],["2,4-D","11.5 uL","23 uL","34.5 uL","69 uL"],["Sucrose","2.0 g","4.0 g","6.0 g","8.0 g"],["D-Glucose","0.06 g","0.12 g","0.18 g","0.36 g"]],"guid":"5F80DE9D58904BFCB527711B736D8C6F","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Ingredient","100 mL","200 mL","300 mL","600 mL"],["605 Medium","1.1 g","2.2 g","3.3 g","6.6 g"],["Casin Hydrolysate","0.03 g","0.06 g","0.09 g","0.18 g"],["2,4-D","11.5 uL","23 uL","34.5 uL","69 uL"],["Sucrose","2.0 g","4.0 g","6.0 g","8.0 g"],["D-Glucose","0.06 g","0.12 g","0.18 g","0.36 g"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4pn3","text":"Add approximately 90% of your final media volume in MQ H2O to your beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jfbh","text":"Place beaker on a magnetic stir plate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3avrl","text":"Turn stir plate on to generate a vigorous stir","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Adjust solution pH to 5.7 with 0.1 M KOH
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fe2j4","text":"Turn on the Hanna Instruments pH meter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"836i3","text":"Unscrew and remove the small green pH probe exchange cover and set cap aside","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjig","text":"Gently remove the probe from the storage tube and set storage tube aside","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gjo0","text":"Using squeeze bottle, rinse the glass probe with H2O, catch rinse water in a waste beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4juis","text":"Gently blot probe with laboratory tissue paper to dry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Adjust solution pH to 5.7 with 0.1 M KOH
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5l89k","text":"Using adjustable arm, lower the pH probe into the beaker with stir plate on","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cau0h","text":"Ensure that the stir bar does not strike the probe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5944m","text":"Electrode at the base of the probe must be fully submerged","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Adjust solution pH to 5.7 with 0.1 M KOH
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8pb0r","text":"Using a plastic transfer pipette, add 0.1M KOH to your solution until you measure pH 5.7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99n8p","text":"NOTE: KOH can be added rapidly until pH 5.4, then add one drop at a time to reach pH 5.7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0p8n","text":"Solution pH between 5.6 - 5.8 is acceptable","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Bring solution to target volume, add phytoagar, and autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3b3vs","text":"Turn off the stir plate and remove your beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43hj1","text":"Hold a large stir bar in your hand to stabilize the one in your beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"folvp","text":"Pour your solution into the graduated cylinder -- Do not include the stir bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjab6","text":"Add a small amount (50-100 mL) of water to your beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a5rv","text":"Carefully add water from the beaker to the graduated cylinder until your solution reaches the target volume -- Do not include the stir bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Bring solution to target volume, add phytoagar, and autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"avmfv","text":"Retrieve a clean dry bottle and matching cap","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c30i","text":"Using a fresh weigh paper and dry spatula/scoopula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99i1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6n0ek","text":"Add phytoagar to dry bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dcjt","text":"NOTE: Adding phytoagar to dry bottle avoids clumping which is undesirable for final media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"E_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,100],"data":[["Ingredient","100 mL","200 mL","300 mL","600 mL"],["Phytoagar","0.6 g","1.2 g","1.8 g","3.6 g"]],"guid":"9F57969586C941CAAB25DB28FCCA7527","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Ingredient","100 mL","200 mL","300 mL","600 mL"],["Phytoagar","0.6 g","1.2 g","1.8 g","3.6 g"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Bring solution to target volume, add phytoagar, and autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"37m32","text":"Loosely place the cap over the bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flfm7","text":"Add a small piece of autoclave tape on the cap and bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9qfc","text":"Place the bottle in an autoclave-safe bin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rnvi","text":"Autoclave 20-25 min using the 'Liquid' setting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4euos","text":"NOTE: Recommended autoclaves are in Cord 3112 and 4112. Complete cycle will take ~1 hr.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Bring solution to target volume, add phytoagar, and autoclave
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6bl6","text":"Rinse all used tools and glassware in running water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efmd6","text":"Place clean items on drying rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7gn7","text":"Return chemical reagents to their original storage location ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Adjust solution pH to 5.7 with 0.1 M KOH
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ffm1g","text":"Using the adjustable arm, remove the pH probe from the beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"de2h8","text":"Using squeeze bottle, rinse the glass probe with H2O, catch rinse water in a waste beaker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48g1p","text":"Gently blot probe with laboratory tissue paper to dry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ick7","text":"Return the probe to the storage tube -- Ensure the electrode bulb is fully submerged in storage solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ba7o9","text":"Return and secure the small probe exchange cover","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1061","text":"Turn off the pH meter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2odgd","text":"Thoroughly rinse all used tools with running water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50o1o","text":"Place clean tools in drying rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cc6","text":"Return chemical reagents to their original storage location","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bb747","text":"Return to the autoclave to pick up your solution -- Be prompt, sucrose can degrade if left too long","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etqhn","text":"Using autoclave gauntlets, gently seal the cap of the bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp4oo","text":"Swirl the autoclaved solution to evenly mix phytoagar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"861l0","text":"Carefully return to the lab with autoclave bin and sealed bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iod9","text":"Place your sealed solution into the large 55C water bath in the main lab","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29ls6","text":"Discard any liquid remaining in the autoclave bin and return to bin storage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o8of","text":"NOTE: Your solution needs to reach ~55C before adding the heat-sensitive ingredients","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"749la","text":"Retrieve the following heat-sensitive ingredients:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nkrh","text":"Dicamba (1 mg/mL) - Stored in Main Lab, -20C Freezer, Bottom drawer 'Tissue Culture 2'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f9jq","text":"Silver nitrate (1 mg/mL) - Stored in Main Lab, -20C Freezer, Bottom drawer 'Tissue Culture 2'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eocmt","text":"Cefotaxime (100 mg/mL), 'Cef' - Stored in Main Lab, -20C Freezer, 'Antibiotics 2'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1egs9","text":"Timentin (300 mg/mL ), 'Tim' - Stored in Main Lab, -20C Freezer, 'Antibiotics 2'","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47fmm","text":"Place reagents in a tube rack and move to laminar flow hood to thaw","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gfmv","text":"Turn on the laminar flow hood, airflow and lamp","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vcen","text":"Using 70% EtOH spray bottle and paper towels, sterilize the working area inside the laminar flow hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u7dl","text":"Retrieve sterile petri plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73ab4","text":"Using a fine-tipped sharpie, write '605CefT' and the date along the bottom rim of the plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjue8","text":"When your solution reads 55C with a digital thermometer gun, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s0qf","text":"transfer your sealed bottle to the laminar flow hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dghef","text":"The bottle should be warm, but safe to handle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ujgq","text":"Sterilize the outside of the bottle and your gloved hands with 70% ethanol spray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a7ha","text":"Using a fresh filter tip for each ingredient, add the following to your bottle:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4p36","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"asuqg","text":"Used tips may be disposed of in regular lab waste -- no contact with rDNA or modified cells is anticipated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"E_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,100],"data":[["Ingredient","100 mL","200 mL","300 mL","600 mL"],["Dicamba","120 uL","240 uL","360 uL","720 uL"],["Silver nitrate","340 uL","680 uL","1020 uL","2040 uL"],["Cef","100 uL","200 uL","300 uL","600 uL"],["Tim","33 uL","67 uL","100 uL","200 uL"]],"guid":"5F80DE9D58904BFCB527711B736D8C6F","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Ingredient","100 mL","200 mL","300 mL","600 mL"],["Dicamba","120 uL","240 uL","360 uL","720 uL"],["Silver nitrate","340 uL","680 uL","1020 uL","2040 uL"],["Cef","100 uL","200 uL","300 uL","600 uL"],["Tim","33 uL","67 uL","100 uL","200 uL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amoek","text":"Gently swirl media bottle to mix thoroughly, but avoid introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dhs7","text":"Pour media into plates, ~30 mL per plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m0bp","text":"NOTE: Each plate should be more than half-full with media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fj9be","text":"Close plates to solidify in laminar flow hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3g49s","text":"Leave closed plates to solidify in the laminar flow hood with the fan on, 3 hrs - overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"597cn","text":"NOTE: Keep plates ~10 cm (4 in) away from the back of the flow hood to avoid drying out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agt1","text":"When plates are solid, wrap in a clean plate bag or individually seal with parafilm and store upside-down at 4C, up to 1 week.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e847v","text":"Using paper towels, clean any spilled media and discard in regular lab waste.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19lum","text":"When plates are poured, rinse media bottle in lab sink and hang on bottle rack to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj1bl","text":"Return reagents to their original storage location.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6a5g","text":"Using 70% EtOH spray bottle and paper towels, sterilize the working area inside the laminar flow hood for the next worker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: 605CefT - Resting Medium (no selection)
